intro: Schinus terebinthifolia var. raddiana, commonly known as Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and bright red berries. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers. It can grow as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters in its native habitat. The berries are toxic to humans and animals, making it important to handle the plant with care.
